title: Hackers exploiting VMware ESXi instances with zero-day exploit toolkit
summary: Threat actors are actively exploiting VMware ESXi hypervisor instances in the wild using a zero-day exploit toolkit chaining multiple vulnerabilities to escape virtual machine isolation.
points: Zero-day exploit toolkit chaining VMware ESXi vulnerabilities in wild activity
Initial access linked to compromised VPN infrastructure
Successful exploitation enables virtual machine escape and host compromise

title: Hackers use malicious imageless QR codes to evade defenses
summary: Attackers are abusing HTML-rendered QR codes built from table cells in phishing emails, bypassing many email security tools and redirecting victims to malicious sites.
points: QR codes rendered in HTML tables bypass traditional image-based defenses
Codes redirect to malicious domains mimicking recipients’ own domains
Users may scan codes in email without realizing the threat

title: WhatsApp leakage allows device fingerprinting via multi-device protocol
summary: WhatsApp’s multi-device encryption implementation leaks metadata that can be used to fingerprint users’ device operating systems, potentially aiding targeted attacks and malware delivery.
points: Multi-device feature reveals device OS fingerprints
Attackers can passively query metadata without user interaction
Partial fixes have been deployed, but risks remain

title: New VVS Stealer malware targets Discord accounts via obfuscated Python code
summary: A Python-based infostealer called VVS Stealer is being used to harvest Discord credentials, tokens, browser data, screenshots, and hijack active sessions, with code obfuscated to evade detection.
points: Targets Discord credentials and tokens
Harvests browser data including cookies and passwords
Uses Pyarmor obfuscation and persistence via Windows Startup

title: Kimwolf Android botnet infects over 2 million devices
summary: The Kimwolf Android botnet has compromised more than 2 million devices by abusing residential proxy networks and exposed Android Debug Bridge (ADB) connections, enabling monetization and large-scale attacks.
points: Botnet leverages exposed ADB and residential proxies to spread
Infected devices form a massive network used for DDoS, proxy resale, and fraud
Rapid growth observed since at least August 2025

title: Russia-aligned hackers abuse Viber to deliver malware to Ukrainian targets
summary: A Russia-aligned threat actor is using the Viber messaging platform to send malicious ZIP archives that deploy the Hijack Loader and Remcos RAT against Ukrainian military and government entities.
points: Malware delivered via Viber messaging instead of email
Attack uses decoy LNK files to run loader and RAT
Advanced evasion tactics make detection difficult

title: Infostealers abused to hijack legitimate business infrastructure for malware hosting
summary: Attackers are using stolen credentials from infostealer malware to take over legitimate business websites and turn them into platforms that host and distribute malware.
points: Stolen credentials from infostealers enable attackers to compromise business infrastructure
Compromised sites are repurposed to host and distribute malware
This creates a self-sustaining criminal cycle harming victims and third parties

title: Fake Eternl Desktop phishing scam targets Cardano users
summary: A sophisticated phishing campaign distributed a fake “Eternl Desktop” wallet installer to lure Cardano ecosystem users, with malicious remote access components embedded in the installer.
points: Fraudulent email mimics official Eternl Desktop release announcement
Download link points to unverified domain and fake installer
Installer contains remote access/monitoring tool enabling unauthorized access

title: Cognizant hit with class-action lawsuits over TriZetto data breach
summary: Cognizant and its subsidiary TriZetto face multiple U.S. class-action lawsuits after a long-running data breach exposed sensitive personal data and delayed notification to victims.
points: Unauthorized access to TriZetto systems went undetected for nearly a year
Sensitive personal data (SSNs, financial info, addresses) were exposed
Lawsuits allege failure to protect data and delayed breach notifications

title: Transparent Tribe deploys new remote access trojan in targeted attacks
summary: A known threat group has launched a new remote access trojan capable of spying, file theft, and persistent system control.
points: Targets specific individuals and organizations
Malware provides full remote control
Designed to evade basic detection

title: Cloud phishing campaign abuses Google Cloud email feature
summary: Cybercriminals abused Google Cloud’s email integration to send thousands of phishing emails that bypass traditional filters and steal credentials.
points: Attack used legitimate Google Cloud automation to send phishing emails
Nearly 9,400 emails sent to over 3,200 organizations
Campaign leverages trusted domains to bypass DMARC/SPF

title: RondoDox botnet exploits critical React2Shell flaw
summary: The RondoDox botnet has been exploiting a critical remote code execution flaw in React Server Components (React2Shell) to hijack IoT devices and web servers, enrolling them into malware and crypto-miner deployments.
points: Botnet abuses a critical Next.js vulnerability for unauthenticated code execution
Over 90,000 exposed systems remain vulnerable worldwide
Payloads include cryptominers, bot loaders, and Mirai variants

title: DarkSpectre browser extension campaigns exposed worldwide
summary: A sophisticated threat actor has run malicious browser extension campaigns over years, affecting millions of Chrome, Edge, and Firefox users to harvest data and corporate intelligence.
points: Multiple campaigns (ShadyPanda, GhostPoster, Zoom Stealer) linked to a single threat actor
Collects browsing data, hijacks affiliate links, and steals corporate meeting intelligence
Over 8.8 million browser users impacted across Chrome, Edge, and Firefox

title: Silver Fox phishing campaign targets Indian taxpayers with ValleyRAT malware
summary: The Silver Fox threat actor used income tax–themed phishing emails and fake software sites to install the modular ValleyRAT remote access trojan on Indian users’ systems.
points: Phishing lures impersonate India’s Income Tax Department
Modular ValleyRAT malware enables persistence and credential theft
Attack chain leverages DLL hijacking and SEO-poisoned download sites

title: Trust Wallet Chrome extension hack causes $7M in crypto losses
summary: A malicious update of the Trust Wallet Chrome extension led to the theft of around $7 million in cryptocurrency from users, prompting urgent patching and reimbursements.
points: Supply-chain compromise of extension version 2.68 injected malicious code
Attackers exfiltrated wallet seed phrases and drained funds
Trust Wallet urged immediate update to version 2.69

title: Fortinet firewalls exposed by active exploitation of critical vulnerabilities
summary: Threat actors are actively exploiting critical authentication bypass and SSO vulnerabilities in Fortinet firewalls and related products, allowing unauthorized access and configuration exports.
points: Critical vulnerabilities in FortiOS and related products are exploited in the wild
Unauthenticated attackers can bypass authentication or gain admin access
Exposure of sensitive firewall configurations and network access
